Package shopping

Class Shopping

java.lang.Object
shopping.Shopping
public class Shopping
extends java.lang.Object
Shopping contains the necessary functionality to handle I/O for the application. It continuously accepts commands from the console and handles them accordingly by calling relevant methods to specific commands.
Author:
Devin Macalalad, David Gasperini

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Shopping()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void add​(ShoppingBag bag, java.lang.String[] line)
    Adds specified item from input to bag via the 'add' method.
    private void checkout​(ShoppingBag bag)
    Checks out the bag by first checking for a non-empty bag, printing each item, then displaying the total of the prices and taxes and summing for the total amount paid.
    private void print​(ShoppingBag bag)
    Prints the bag by first checking if its non-empty, then calls the 'print' method.
    private void remove​(ShoppingBag bag, java.lang.String[] line)
    Removes specified item from the bag.
    void run()
    Accepts input commands from console and calls helper methods accordingly until user quits.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Shopping

      public Shopping()

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Accepts input commands from console and calls helper methods accordingly until user quits. Invalid commands are handled by outputting an error message, valid commands give validation output.

    • checkout

      private void checkout​(ShoppingBag bag)
      Checks out the bag by first checking for a non-empty bag, printing each item, then displaying the total of the prices and taxes and summing for the total amount paid. If the bag is empty, and error is displayed.
      Parameters:
      shopping - bag object to be checked out.

    • print

      private void print​(ShoppingBag bag)
      Prints the bag by first checking if its non-empty, then calls the 'print' method. If the bag is empty, and error is displayed.
      Parameters:
      shopping - bag object to be printed.

    • add

      private void add​(ShoppingBag bag, java.lang.String[] line)
      Adds specified item from input to bag via the 'add' method.
      Parameters:
      shopping - bag to add to.
      input - line to extract command from.

    • remove

      private void remove​(ShoppingBag bag, java.lang.String[] line)
      Removes specified item from the bag. If the item is not found, an error is displayed.
      Parameters:
      shopping - bag to remove item from
      input - line to extract command from.
